Disney is investing $1.5 billion into Epic Games, the creator of Fortnite, which was last valued at $32 billion in a 2022 raise. The companies plan to collaborate on new games utilizing Disney IP such as Star Wars, Marvel, and Pixar as the House of Mouse evolves from cinematic to entertainment universes. Disney has experimented with games in the past, most notably with Disney Infinity, but executives never seemed to be “all in,” and the experiment fizzled. This partnership is a glass slipper (another Disney property…), allowing Disney to outsource the game development process itself to a highly capable team while offering Epic invaluable brand assets to build around. Either that, or Bob Igor just really doesn’t want to get sued for anticompetitive practices… #Disney #BobIgor #StarWars #Marvel #EpicGames

Over the year, #gamers spent $98.7 billion on video games. 🎮In August, the top 10 #best-selling video games in the world (retail and digital) included: 1. #Madden NFL 24 2. #ArmoredCore VI: Fires of Rubicon 3. #Remnant II 4. #CallofDuty: Modern Warfare 2 (2022) 5. #HogwartsLegacy 6. #TheLegendofZelda: Tears of the Kingdom 7. #Diablo IV 8. #MLB: The Show 23 9. #Minecraft 10. #MarioKart 8 🪄By the way, Hogwarts Legacy was named the best-selling video game of the first quarter of 2023. Warner Bros. Entertainment. reported that at the time of the game's launch, its sales were 256% of planned. Thus, two weeks after the game's release, more than 12 million copies were sold, and global sales amounted to $850 million. The NPD Group published the rating, a company providing industry expertise and analytics, to reflect the situation in retail trade. We took the rest of the data from Worldometers and INSIDER GAMING.

Disney buys a $1.5B stake in Epic games and will create its own universe in Fortnite 🎢 Disney and Epic Games are partnering in what it could be a game-changer for a new "Disney Experience". This is not the first time both companies have collaborated as we've seen others successful IP collaborations in Fortnite With the recent success in the past months from Disney that reported a 49% increase in profits, this comes as a investment for the future. This is a clear example of how you have to adapt the new audience and gaming is the right market to promote your brands and IPs. Going to Disney World is great but not everyone can do it and much less on a daily basis. Creating this universe will allow players to do that and will open a huge number of new possibilities for Disney to engage with their current audience and the new generations. With the raise of more games going to live services, IPs and Brands have the perfect opportunity to access to new markets, engage new audiences and increase their visibility. This is just another example of what the future will look like and how the new "window display" is gaming! Disney is taking a bold leap into the gaming world with a whopping $1.5 billion investment in Epic Games, the creators of Fortnite. This strategic partnership will bring Disney's beloved brands into the gaming universe, targeting the ever-growing Gen Z and millennial demographics. With the massive popularity of Fortnite and its record-breaking collaborations, the potential of this venture is clear. Under CEO Bob Iger's leadership, Disney's focus on innovation and growth is evident, as seen in exclusive content like Taylor Swift's "Eras Tour" concert film coming to Disney Plus. This partnership promises to be a transformative journey, and we can't wait to see what's in store! 🌟🎮 Link to the article: https://lnkd.in/eZWhyF4R #Disney #EpicGames #Fortnite #GamingIndustry #Innovation

https://lnkd.in/eFhknCGc Disney and Epic Games announced a new partnership yesterday, as Disney invested $1.5bn in Epic to take a minority shareholding. Epic founder Tim Sweeney said they will work together to "build a persistent, open and interoperable ecosystem that will bring together the Disney and Fortnite communities." The move appears to make a huge amount of sense to both companies, with Disney trying to secure a foothold in the gaming space (6 years after the demise of Disney Infinity) and Epic looking to boost Fortnite's appeal even further. Whether Disney can make a meaningful impact on the gaming space beyond skin gimmicks and nostalgia-mining remains to be seen, but if there's one thing they have a track record in, it is building a universe. Disney x Fortnite has the potential to be a particularly potent partnership. #CMSGaming #cmslaw #epicgames #Disney

🐭 🏰 Disney’s “Epic” Games Investment 🕹 Last week, The Walt Disney Company announced it had bought a $1.5B stake in Epic Games, and that the two companies will develop a Disney universe within Fortnite. CEO Bob Iger says it’s Disney’s “biggest entry ever into the world of games.” Considering the $1.5B investment, he is technically correct – however, the Disney game business has existed for over 30 years. It’s a significant enough stake to consider Epic married to Disney, and it’s unlikely that a single Disney Fortnite game will be the last we see of this partnership. It’s also worth considering Epic’s role in challenging Apple and Google’s platform duopoly now that the fight is silently supported by Sony and Disney, both with their own mobile ambitions. It is exciting to see the games industry continuing to evolve, and we can only begin to imagine the variety of products and content that would come out of this partnership.
